params.text:
• Ask someone to hold
  • Ask for the name and spelling
  • Get someone to repeat

Telephone

Answer a Call Part 1

Language in Action
Telephone: Introduction

Today you will learn how to answer the phone in English.

By the end of this lesson, you will be able to:

1. Ask someone to hold: This means you will learn how to say "Can you hold, please?" or "Hold on, please."

  2. Ask for the name and spelling: You will learn how to ask "Who’s calling, please?" and "Could you spell that, please?"

  3. Get someone to repeat: You will learn how to say "Sorry, I didn’t catch that" or "Could you repeat that, please?"
Ask Someone To Hold – Flashcards

dialogs.answer: Use this phrase when you need to put someone on hold.
A more informal way to ask someone to wait.
Use this phrase when you need a short amount of time.
A more formal way to ask someone to hold.
A very informal way to ask someone to wait a short time.

params.text: Ask Someone To Hold - Listening & Quiz
Anthony wants to speak to customer service. Please listen to the call and answer the questions:

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: What does Anthony want to do?
answers:
Speak to customer service

Hang up the phone

Leave a message

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: What happens after Anthony makes the call?
answers:
He is put on hold

He speaks to a customer service representative

He leaves a message

params.text: Anthony:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Dialogue Text:

Anthony: Hello, this is Anthony. I’d like to speak to customer service, please.

Phone: Thank you for calling Hartfors Trading. Please hold, and your call will be answered shortly. You are number 12 in the queue.

params.textField:
Receptionist: Good *morning*. How can I *help* you?
Anthony: Good morning. I have an *appointment* with Mr. Johnson at 10 am.
Receptionist: Alright, Mr. Johnson is *expecting* you. Could I *please* have your name for the *sign-in* sheet?
Anthony: Sure, it’s Anthony Davidson.
Receptionist: And how do you spell your *last* name?
Anthony: D-A-V-I-D-S-O-N.

Ask For The Name And Spelling - Listening & Quiz
Please listen to the following conversation and answer the questions:

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: Who initiated the request for the client's name?
Question 2 of 3: What was the client's last name?
Question 3 of 3: Why did Abigail ask for the spelling of the client's last name?
answers:
She was unsure of the correct spelling.

It was a standard procedure.

Bryan requested her to do so.

params.text: Abigail:
Bryan:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Dialogue Text:

Abigail: Hello there, and welcome! I'm Abigail, your consultant for today. Could I get your name, please?

Bryan: Hi Abigail, nice to meet you. My name is Bryan Miller.

Abigail: Great, Bryan. Thank you. Just to confirm, is that M-I-L-L-E-R?
Get Someone To Repeat – Flashcards

dialogs.answer: Use this phrase when you didn't hear something clearly or want to confirm information.
This is a polite way to say you didn't understand what someone said.
A simple way to indicate you missed what was said.
A direct way to ask someone to say something again.
Use this when you need to hear something clearly for a second time.

dialogs.text: I'm sorry, what did you say?
dialogs.answer: A polite way to ask for repetition when you didn't hear something.

metadata.title: Get Someone To Repeat Drag the Words

params.text: Get Someone To Repeat: Quiz
Please answer the following questions:

choices.question: Question 1 of 4: Which phrase is the most polite way to ask someone to repeat something?
Question 2 of 4: If you didn't hear something clearly, which phrase would you use?
answers:
I didn't quite catch that.

Speak louder!

You're mumbling.

choices.question: Question 3 of 4: Which phrase is appropriate if you want to ask someone to repeat something for a second time?
answers:
One more time, please.

Say it again.

Repeat yourself.

choices.question: Question 4 of 4: Which phrase shows that you are apologizing for not understanding?
answers:
I'm sorry, what did you say?

Repeat.

Say it again.

l10n.a11yShowSolution: Show the solution. The task will be marked with its correct solution.
l10n.a11yRetry: Retry the task. Reset all responses and start the task over again.

params.text: Module Summary Quiz
Choose the BEST answer for each question to demonstrate your understanding of the key skills for concluding telephone module effectively.

choices.question: Question 1 of 4: Which phrase is best for asking someone to repeat their name if you didn't hear it clearly?
answers:
"Could you say your name again, please?"

"What?"

"Speak louder!"

choices.question: Question 2 of 4: Which of the following is NOT a polite way to ask someone to repeat something?
answers:
"Huh?"

"Could you say that again?"

"I didn't quite catch that."

choices.question: Question 3 of 4: Why is it important to ask for the spelling of someone's name?
answers:
Both A and B

To ensure correct pronunciation

To avoid misunderstandings

choices.question: Question 4 of 4: Which of the following scenarios would require you to ask someone to repeat something?
answers:
Both A and B

When you want to confirm information

When you didn't hear what the person said clearly
